channel.title: Weird
channel.description: For some reason, there's a raised area in my left armpit. I think it's possibly som pus-filled monstrousity seeing that it hurts when I poke at it and stuff. It pretty much popped out of nowhere a few days ago, but the reason's unclear.

item.title: Weird
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

xstrxpurez:

lol ya… having a big one right below or on your balls… that would suck ass and when u walk it would hurt…

If that were so you would have testicular cancer,
Common from the age of 15+ ,
.
Get the lumps checked

Read full topic

item.title: Weird
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

[quote=“xstrxpurez, post:25, topic:231651”][quote author=Chimaera God link=topic=305123.msg2446875#msg2446875 date=1221778737]

I think its probably just a swolen lymph node. To my knowledge they are the things which excrete sweat. It usually means you’re going to get a cold or a cough.

Should go in a week.

If not then I’m completely wrong as to what it is.

I’m coughing up snot and coughing up a storm.

Talk about irony.

how is that irony

because its weird how david said that then he starts getting sick.

I’ve been sick since Sunday.
[/quote]
wow man… you need to get that checked… and then if it has puss in it… get a needle and stick it in it lol.[/quote]

It hurts like a bitch to get that done. The bumps weren’t as big today for some reason, dunno why though,

Read full topic

item.title: Weird
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

[quote=“Project Evolution, post:12, topic:231651”][quote author=Chimaera God link=topic=305123.msg2445584#msg2445584 date=1221701643]

It could possibly be the beginning of staff infection…

Doesn’t that kill?

If it gets serious enough it can. I had a brief run-in with mercer (mild staff) last year when I started playing football.
[/quote]
It could even be that some bacteria from the last time you got it stayed in your armpit and built up. :([/quote]

Well I would feel that there would be no bacteria seeing that I bathe on a regular basis, more like 3 times a day, so I can stay staff-free.

Read full topic
